My mother kept a stack of newspapers by the kitchen table. Not to read. She'd already read them. She kept them because the table wobbled, and a folded page of the Duluth Herald from October 1971 was exactly the right thickness. It worked for twenty-three years. It survived three moves, two dogs, and my entire childhood.

In 2019, I bought a chair that needed an app. The app needed my email. The email triggered a firmware update. The firmware update failed. The chair vibrated for three days. I called support. They told me to check my WiFi.

The newspaper under the table leg was never the problem.

— Gwen Finchwood, Duluth, MN

"mom's method. 26 years. no firmware."
